Blog.post: I will not hide behind your filter. I will not live inside your box, made thick with compassion/oppression and religious absolution/absoluteness. I will speak on truths that do not flow as psalms and hymns; not praising or comforting but truths, nonetheless. Truths like brothers that kill brothers and whores that can love. I will speak on anger, distrust and uncertainty with God - yes, The Creator - because it happens, it's true. I will question the decisions of powerful men and misled sheep, lost, and waiting for the true Shepherd to return. I will speak on all this if I feel the need, while you sit quietly and carefully craft your scriptural response; So as not to offend (heaven's no) but to straighten me out as I must be astray. I will speak of these truths as you shift in your seat, longing to be back in the pew where hymns and homilies are lilting and loving; Where ritual is certain and change is unwelcome; Where words chanted in unison bind us in word and belief. Chanting that is without dissent - the same words - the same convictions - the SAME faith, for an hour at least. I will speak the cold, dark and sometimes angry truths. I will bring them out of the darkness and silence that gives them shelter and strength. I will shine the light of knowledge on them for an hour at least.
